I worked as a Sworn Police Officer for 10 years and have been employed as a Sr. Special Investigator or Manager within the insurance industry for 30 years. Let me transform this resume into a narrative story:

For over four decades, a dedicated professional has carved out a remarkable career in law enforcement and insurance fraud investigation. Beginning his journey in 1972, he started as a Deputy Sheriff, working in various facilities including the Biscailuz Center Jail and Main County Jail. His passion for law enforcement led him to a decade-long career as a Police Officer, where he patrolled the streets, conducted special investigations, and even served in the Traffic Division as a motorcycle officer.

In 1983, he made a pivotal career shift that would define his professional legacy. Recognizing the emerging problem of insurance fraud, he stepped into the world of insurance investigations. This transition proved to be perfectly timed, as the insurance industry was just beginning to grapple with the growing challenge of fraudulent claims.

His expertise and leadership qualities didn't go unnoticed. By 1987, he was promoted to Supervising SIU Investigator at Continental Insurance, where he managed multiple offices across Costa Mesa, Pleasanton, Tucson, and even Honolulu. Under his watch, he led teams of investigators and support staff, demonstrating his ability to coordinate complex operations across different locations.

Throughout the 1990s and early 2000s, he continued to build his reputation as a Senior Special Investigator, working with prestigious companies like USAA and handling increasingly complex cases. His investigations spanned a wide range of fraudulent activities, from bodily injury accidents to auto theft, burglary, and property theft.

The pinnacle of his career came with his role as Senior Special Investigator for the Specialty Group of Great American, where he served as the sole investigator for the Western SIU Office, covering 14 states. His investigations encompassed workers' compensation, liability, property claims, and specialized areas like agriculture and equine claims.

Throughout his career, he never stopped learning. He earned multiple certifications, including the prestigious Certified Insurance Fraud Investigator (CIFI) credential, a Senior Claims Law Associate Degree, and a Senior Fraud Claims Specialist Degree. His educational background, which includes an Associate's Degree in Criminology and a Bachelor's in Management, provided a strong foundation for his work.

Perhaps most importantly, he has given back to the industry by conducting numerous training sessions, teaching others how to recognize the 'red flags' of insurance fraud. His legacy isn't just in the cases he's solved, but in the knowledge he's passed on to the next generation of investigators.

This is the story of a professional who has dedicated his life to fighting fraud and protecting the integrity of the insurance industry, combining the sharp instincts of a law enforcement officer with the analytical skills of an investigator to make a lasting impact in his field.
